title: Master of Arts in Architectural History Application Instructions | School of Architecture
raw_text:
Master of Arts in Architectural History Application Instructions
MASTER OF ARTS IN ARCHITECTURAL HISTORY APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS
[  ] Follow the
application instructions
for all UTSOA graduate programs.
[  ] See below for MA application requirements.
Application materials are reviewed for evidence of a specialised interest in any relevant area, including but not limited to Architectural History, Building Technology, Community Equity Design, Community and Regional Planning, Digital Technology, Environmental Equity Design, Historic Preservation, Interior Design, Latin American Architecture, Sustainable Design, or Urban Design.
PREREQUISITES
Prerequisites include 9 hours of architectural history or a related spatial discipline. This may include courses in art history, history, geography, planning, or related subjects.
GRADUATE SCHOOL REQUIREMENTS
[  ] Follow the
Graduate School instructions
to submit the
application
, application fee, transcripts and test scores. Once submitted to the Graduate School, transcripts and test scores can take up to one month to process.
+ The GRE is required for MA.
STATEMENT OF PURPOSE
[  ] Upload your statement through
MyStatus
.
+ A 1,000-1,500 word essay that describes the scholarly topic and area of study you wish to pursue. Please discuss why you want to pursue this topic in the MA program at UTSOA and your professional objectives. You may wish to include a situation or job that helped you define your area of interest.
+ You may submit your
online application
before
finishing your statement of purpose. You can later upload your statement through
MyStatus
.
THREE LETTERS OF RECOMMENDATION
[  ] Manage and track your letters through
MyStatus
.
[  ] Provide recommenders' emails as part of the
online application
.
+ Recommenders may include former instructors and professional employers.
+ Letters should include comments on the applicant’s intellectual, communicative, and leadership abilities as well as their capacity for creativity and relevant personal characteristics.
+ After you submit your application and pay your application fee, notification emails will be sent to your recommenders. Any delay in submitting your application or application fee will delay the notifications to your recommenders.
RESUME OR CURRICULUM VITAE
[  ] Upload through
MyStatus
.
WRITING SAMPLE
[  ]  Upload through
MyStatus
.
+ This document should demonstrate your analytical writing and reasoning skills.
+ Submit a full-length scholarly paper (12-20 pages). A shorter paper may be submitted if it is analytically strong and focuses on a single topic.
APPLICATION DEADLINE:
December 15
SUPPLEMENTAL MATERIALS DUE:
January 3

extracted_fields.program_name: Master of Arts in Architectural History

courses.name: ALTERNATIVE HISTORIES AND THEORETICAL DIRECTIONS IN COMPUTATIONAL DESIGN
CONTEMPORARY ARCHITECTURE THEORY BY CASE STUDY
CORNER PROBLEMS: THE HISTORY OF TECTONICS IN ARCHITECTURE
HISTORY OF ITALIAN ARCHITECTURE AND ITS INFLUENCE
MAY TERM: CRITICAL WORKS OF MODERN AND EMERGENT ARCHITECTURE - EUROPE
MAY TERM: RESILIENT DESIGN: CLIMATE ADAPTATION
RENDERING AND ANIMATION OF THE BUILT ENVIRONMENT
SPATIAL STORIES (AN EXPLORATION OF NARRATIVE, SPACE + TIME)
SUPER-HOUSING: SUPERBLOCK, HOUSING, & THE COLLECTIVE IMAGINARIES

application_requirements.academic_background: Specialised interest in areas such as Architectural History, Building Technology, Community Equity Design, etc.
application_requirements.prerequisites: 9 hours of architectural history or a related spatial discipline.
application_requirements.gre: The GRE is required for MA.
application_requirements.documents: Statement of Purpose, Three Letters of Recommendation, Resume or Curriculum Vitae, Writing Sample.
application_requirements.summary: Applicants must have a specialised interest in relevant areas, complete 9 hours of architectural history or related courses, submit GRE scores, and provide a statement of purpose, letters of recommendation, a resume, and a writing sample.

[ ] See below for MA application requirements. Application materials are reviewed for evidence of a specialised interest in any relevant area, including but not limited to Architectural History, Building Technology, Community Equity Design, Community and Regional Planning, Digital Technology, Environmental Equity Design, Historic Preservation, Interior Design, Latin American Architecture, Sustainable Design, or Urban Design.
